name: Kawazuhama Beach
description: Kawazu Beach is a beautiful sandy beach with crystal-clear water and scenic views. It's a popular spot for swimming, sunbathing, and beach sports.

reviews.content: Kawazu Beach is a perfect spot for a day of fun in the sun with family and friends. The beach is clean, the water is crystal-clear, and the scenery is breathtaking. I highly recommend this beach!
I had a great time at Kawazu Beach. The sand is soft and the water is warm and inviting. It's the perfect place to relax and unwind.
Kawazu Beach is one of the best beaches I've been to in Japan. The scenery is amazing, and the water is perfect for swimming and snorkeling. I also appreciate the beach's facilities and amenities.
If you're looking for a beautiful, serene beach, Kawazu Beach is the perfect choice. It's not too crowded, and the water is calm and clear. I had a wonderful time here.
Kawazu Beach is a hidden gem in the Izu Peninsula. The sand is soft and the water is crystal-clear. It's a great place to swim, sunbathe, or just relax and enjoy the beautiful scenery.

name: Imaihama Beach
description: Imaihama Beach is a picturesque white-sand beach located in Kawazu, known for its crystal-clear turquoise waters, great snorkeling, and scenic views of Mount Fuji. There are several beachside restaurants and cafes, as well as camping sites and accommodations in the area.

name: Usami Beach
description: The spacious and open Usami Beach has a wide and shallow sand beach stretching 1.5 kilometers, located just next to the parking lot, so it is quite popular. The sea opening is from mid July to late August, with sea guards on constant watch during this period. You can enjoy surfing in the mornings and evenings too.

reviews.content: If your from Australia which I am I found the beaches on the Shizuoka eastern coast unfit to swim in. They cope all the plastics and butt flowing out of Tokyo Bay washing up on their grey sands...
My father was born here.He was working in Tokyo, and returned to the area after his retirement.Not much of attraction nor place of interest.Still, I feel at home here.Nice view and relaxing...

Beautiful beach that’s about 10 min south of Ajiro. The beach stretches for more than a mile and is much less crowded than Atami. No shower I’m but has a place with fresh water where you can clean yourself up.
Clean beach with less crowd can have a great time

There is usually only a  narrow strip of sand but there is shallow water to swim in, and it's never as busy as Atami. The water is clean. There are two toilet blocks and an ice cream store. There is scuba diving. It's a nice place. Pretty quiet. Lots of people surf here. You can sometimes see jumping fish.
